task-wr.title: Creating a Static Resource
task-wr.shortdesc: The BootFromCinder.yaml template illustrates the use of templates to create static resources.

context.p: This HOT template creates a volume and a VM using this volume. The VM name is specified as a parameter in the template, illustrating the use of HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade extensions to simplify VM instance naming. It is used by the OS::Nova::Server resources, which define the construction of the VMs.
The VM has two attached networks.

step.cmd: Collect the required parameter values for this template.

info.p: For information about flavors, keypairs, images, or tenant networks, see the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade Reference Deployment Scenarios: User Tasks.

substep.cmd: On the same page, locate and record an internal network to provide connectivity for the stack.

step.cmd: Select the template, then click Browse and select BootFromCinder.yaml from the local disk.
Use the Launch Stack form to provide the required parameter values for the template.
